Module.Name: PBK model definitions
Module.Description: Physiologically based kinetic (PBK) models are mathematical representations of biological organisms designed to describe and predict the time-dependent processes of absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion (ADME) of chemicals across tissues and organs. PBK model definitions establish the structural framework of these models - specifying compartments, chemical species, and their interconnections - without prescribing specific parameter values. When combined with parameter values, these definitions enable the estimation of internal chemical concentrations from external exposures, and vice versa.
Module.DataDescription: PBK models can either be uploaded as data (in the SBML format) or can be selected from the collection of embedded models
